author: Special Correspondent
text:
The house of former AIADMK legislator Pala. Karuppiah became a hub of political activity on Saturday with leaders of various political parties calling on him .

“Everyone condemned the attack and expressed their solidarity. I am touched by their words of encouragement,” said Mr. Karuppiah.

His house on Besant Street off Lloyds Road was attacked on Friday night.

“The women and children were rattled by the incident. People threw stones at the windows and shouted asking me to come out,” he said.

While leaders, including CPI (M) State secretary G. Ramakrishnan and senior leader T. K. Rangarajan, VCK’s Thol Thirumavalavan, CPI State secretary R. Mutharasan, senior leader K. Subbarayan and N. Periyasamy called on him, DMK treasurer M.K. Stalin and former Mayor M. Subramanian, TNCC president E.V.K.S. Elangovan, MDMK leader Vaiko and Dravidar Kazhagam general secretary K. Veeramani spoke to him over the phone.

“What touched me the most was a statement by DMK leader M. Karunanidhi who condemned the incident. I have been a severe critic of his and the support came despite all that. Mr. Mutharasan was saying that the DMK chief was a very mature person and politician and that there was no need to be surprised about the statement,” Mr. Karuppiah said.

With visits by leaders of so many political leaders, the air is thick with the talk that they were all wooing Mr. Karuppiah, who was expelled from the AIADMK recently.
title: Political leaders condemn attack
